arm_group.description: Healthy volunteers,patients with hyperlipidemia,a known medical history of cardiovascular diseases or type 2 diabetes mellitus.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine the impact of  alcohol consumption in diurnal
      triglyceridemia in a free living situation.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diurnal Triglyceridemia in Relation to Alcohol Intake

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy volunteers

        Patients with:

          -  Hyperlipidemia

          -  Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

          -  Cardiovascular diseases

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Renal disease

          -  Liver  disease

          -  Thyroid disease

study_pop.textblock:
Subjects were healthy volunteers or patients with hyperlipidemia or a known medical
        history of cardiovascular diseases, type 2 diabetes mellitus participating in several
        clinical studies with the same protocol, aimed to investigate factors influencing
        postprandial lipemia

clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study of Diurnal Triglyceridemia in Relation to Alcohol Intake

primary_outcome.description: Capillary triglyceridemia  was measured by a triglyceride testing device on six fixed time-points.
primary_outcome.measure: Determination of diurnal triglyceridemia depend on alcohol intake

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gender differences in diurnal triglyceridemia by alcohol consumption

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
